Left thoracoscopy and left thoracotomy w.context: Left thoracoscopy and left thoracotomy with declaudication and drainage of lung abscesses, and multiple biopsies of pleura and lung.

Empyema of the left chest.context:
Postoperative Diagnoses:
Empyema of the left chest, consolidation of the left lung, lung abscesses of the left upper lobe and left lower lobe.

consolidation of the left lung.context:
Postoperative Diagnoses:
Empyema of the left chest, consolidation of the left lung, lung abscesses of the left upper lobe and left lower lobe.

lung abscesses.context:
Postoperative Diagnoses:
Empyema of the left chest, consolidation of the left lung, lung abscesses of the left upper lobe and left lower lobe.

respiratory symptoms.context: The patient has a complex history, which goes back about four months ago when she started having respiratory symptoms and one week ago she was admitted to another hospital with hemoptysis

hemoptysis.context: and one week ago she was admitted to another hospital with hemoptysis and on her evaluation there which included two CAT scans of chest she was found to have marked consolidation of the left lung

marked consolidation.context: she was found to have marked consolidation of the left lung with a questionable lung abscess or cavity with hydropneumothorax.

lung abscess or cavity.context: she was found to have marked consolidation of the left lung with a questionable lung abscess or cavity with hydropneumothorax.

hydropneumothorax.context: she was found to have marked consolidation of the left lung with a questionable lung abscess or cavity with hydropneumothorax.

mild infiltrates.context: There was also noted to be some mild infiltrates of the right lung.

cigarette smoking.context: The patient had a 30-year history of cigarette smoking.

brownish fluid.context: which produced some brownish fluid that had foul odor, actually what was thought to be a fecal-like odor.

fecal-like odor.context: which produced some brownish fluid that had foul odor, actually what was thought to be a fecal-like odor.

erythema.context: There was also remarkably bloody secretions were also noted. These were suctioned, but it was enough to produce a temporary obstruction of the left mainstem bronchus. Eventually, the double lumen tube was secured and an attempt at a left thoracoscopy was performed after the chest tube was removed and digital dissection was carried out through that. The chest tube tract, which was about in the sixth or seventh intercostal space, but it was not possible to dissect enough down to get a acceptable visualization through this tract. A second incision for thoracoscopy was made about on the sixth intercostal space in the midaxillary line and again some digital dissection was carried out but it was not enough to be able to achieve an opening or space for satisfactory inspection of the pleural cavity. Therefore the chest was opened and remarkably findings included a very dense consolidation of the entire lung such that it was very hard and firm throughout. Remarkably, the surface of the lower lobe laterally was not completely covered with a fibrotic line, but it was more the line anterior and posterior and more of it over the left upper lobe. There were many pockets of purulent material, which had a gray-white appearance to it. There was quite a bit of whitish fibrotic fibrinous deposit on the parietal pleura of the lung especially the upper lobe. The adhesions were taken down and they were quite bloody in some areas indicating that the process had been present for some time.

bloody secretions.context: There was also remarkably bloody secretions were also noted. These were suctioned, but it was enough to produce a temporary obstruction of the left mainstem bronchus.

dense consolidation.context: The findings included a very dense consolidation of the entire lung such that it was very hard and firm throughout.

purulent material.context: There were many pockets of purulent material, which had a gray-white appearance to it.

fibrotic fibrinous deposit.context: There was quite a bit of whitish fibrotic fibrinous deposit on the parietal pleura of the lung especially the upper lobe.

adhesions.context: The adhesions were taken down and they were quite bloody in some areas indicating that the process had been present for some time.

cavity.context: There seemed to be an abscess that was about 3 cm in dimension, all the lateral basilar segment of the lower lobe near the area where the chest tube was placed. Many cultures were taken from several areas. The most remarkable finding was a large cavity, which was probably about 11 cm in dimension, containing grayish pus and also caseous-like material, it was thought to be perhaps necrotic lung tissue, perhaps a deposit related to tuberculosis in the cavity.

caseous-like material.context: The most remarkable finding was a large cavity, which was probably about 11 cm in dimension, containing grayish pus and also caseous-like material, it was thought to be perhaps necrotic lung tissue, perhaps a deposit related to tuberculosis in the cavity.

tuberculosis.context: it was thought to be perhaps necrotic lung tissue, perhaps a deposit related to tuberculosis in the cavity.

cultures.context: Many cultures were taken from several areas.

biopsies.context: Many cultures were taken from several areas. The most remarkable finding was a large cavity, which was probably about 11 cm in dimension, containing grayish pus and also caseous-like material, it was thought to be perhaps necrotic lung tissue, perhaps a deposit related to tuberculosis in the cavity.     The apex of the lung was quite densely adhered to the parietal pleura there and the adhesions were quite thickened and firm. Biopsies were taken from multiple sites on the pleura and on the edge and on the lung.

saline.context: This was suctioned out with the addition of the use of saline ***** in the bronchus.

Prolene.context: Suture ligatures of Prolene were required.

thrombin.context: Also on the pulmonary artery repair some ***** material was used and also thrombin, Gelfoam and Surgicel.

Blake chest tubes.context: Then two #24 Blake chest tubes were placed, one through a stab wound above the incision anteriorly and one below and one in the inferior pleural space and tubes were brought out through stab wounds necked into the skin with 0 silk.

Vicryl.context: The chest wall was closed with running #1 Vicryl and then 2-0 Vicryl subcutaneous and staples on the skin.
